books.title: The Able McLaughlins
books.author: Margaret Wilson
books.summary: The eldest son of Scottish immigrants farming the Iowa prairie struggles to help his soon-to-be wife recover from the violent act that could ruin both of their lives.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: A young girl follows a white rabbit into a strange land of poetry, humor, and whimsy.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of P. G. Wodehouse’s short fiction.

books.title: Timon of Athens
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A wealthy Athenian lord becomes poor and friendless after his “friends” take advantage of his hospitality.

books.title: The Worm Ouroboros
books.author: E. R. Eddison
books.summary: The King Gorice of Witchland and the lords of Demonland wage war in the high-fantasy lands of Mercury.

books.title: Mr. Standfast
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: An army general chases a network of German spies through Scotland, the Swiss Alps, and the First World War’s Western Front.

books.title: The Return
books.author: Walter de la Mare
books.summary: After visiting a graveyard, a man finds his appearance has mysteriously changed.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: The Bungalow Mystery
books.author: Carolyn Keene
books.summary: A young amateur detective investigates a new friend’s abusive guardian.

books.title: Histories
books.author: Herodotus
books.summary: Herodotus recounts the history and geography of the ancient world.

books.title: The American Crisis
books.author: Thomas Paine
books.summary: A collection of articles written during the American Revolutionary War that outline Paine’s support for a self-governing America.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: James McIntyre
books.summary: A collection of poetry by James McIntyre.

books.title: Northanger Abbey
books.author: Jane Austen
books.summary: A young girl with an overactive imagination comes of age.

books.title: The Big Time
books.author: Fritz Leiber
books.summary: A motley collection of servicemembers escape a plot as two mysterious factions wage an epic war across time itself.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: A collection of short stories by H. G. Wells in a variety of genres ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
